summary.purpose: Defines feature-flag enumerations scoped per application context (Board, Client, Dashboard, Installer, Toolbox) and a typed user-permissions interface.
summary.problem_solved: Centralises all feature-flag identifiers for the platform so that every application uses the same string keys, preventing typos, mismatches, and permission-check drift across services.

exports.name: FeaturesBoard
exports.description_one_line: Feature flags available to board-level hardware configuration

exports.name: FeaturesClient
exports.description_one_line: Feature flags that control capabilities visible to end-client users

exports.name: FeaturesDashboard
exports.description_one_line: Feature flags representing role-based access levels in the dashboard application

exports.name: FeaturesInstaller
exports.description_one_line: Feature flags controlling installer-app capabilities and access levels

exports.name: FeaturesToolbox
exports.description_one_line: Feature flags for the toolbox admin application, declared as ambient enum

exports.name: UserPermissionsObject
exports.description_one_line: Typed map of per-application feature flag activation states for a user

exports.name: userPermissionsObjectValue
exports.description_one_line: Utility type extracting the key union for a given UserPermissionsObject application property

symbols.name: FeaturesBoard
symbols.description_one_line: Feature flags available to board-level hardware configuration

details.what_it_does: Enumerates feature identifiers specific to hardware board configuration. Currently contains one member: extra_battery, enabling boards that support auxiliary battery management.

returns.description: A string enum member identifying the board feature.

minimal_correct.title: Check if a board has the extra_battery feature

symbols.name: FeaturesClient
symbols.description_one_line: Feature flags that control capabilities visible to end-client users

details.what_it_does: Enumerates 16 feature-flag string values that can be assigned to a client account to unlock specific application capabilities. Features include PDI workflows, alert management, biometry, EV charge tracking, SMS/email contact options, remote engine cut, door monitoring, keypad management, polygon scheduling, and more.

returns.description: A string enum member identifying the client feature.

minimal_correct.title: Check if a client has charge tracking enabled

extensive_correct.title: Filter UI actions based on client features

incorrect.title: Using raw string literals for feature checks
incorrect.why_incorrect: Raw strings bypass TypeScript checks and will not be caught by IDE refactoring tools if a feature key is renamed.

symbols.name: FeaturesDashboard
symbols.description_one_line: Feature flags representing role-based access levels in the dashboard application

details.what_it_does: Enumerates five role identifiers used by the dashboard application: client_admin, site_admin, capacity_admin, dashboard_user, and super_admin. Each member maps to an access tier that controls which sections of the dashboard UI are visible or editable.

returns.description: A string enum member identifying the dashboard role.

minimal_correct.title: Check if user has super-admin access in the dashboard

symbols.name: FeaturesInstaller
symbols.description_one_line: Feature flags controlling installer-app capabilities and access levels

details.what_it_does: Enumerates eight feature flags for the installer mobile/web application: super_technician, installer, uninstall, maintenance, desktop_mode, tests, tools, and access_all_clients. These flags determine which workflows and screens a field technician can access.

returns.description: A string enum member identifying the installer feature.

minimal_correct.title: Check if an installer can access all clients

symbols.name: FeaturesToolbox
symbols.description_one_line: Ambient enum of feature flags for the toolbox admin application

details.what_it_does: Declares (as an ambient enum, hence `declare enum`) 14 feature-flag string values for the toolbox administration panel. Members cover super_admin, toolbox_user, car_catalog, sms_configurations, tools, equipment_options, manage_equipment, manage_boards, manage_clients, manage_users, manage_cars, manage_credits, call_center_user, and clients_scope. Being ambient means the enum is expected to exist at runtime via an external definition.

returns.description: A string enum member identifying the toolbox feature.

minimal_correct.title: Check toolbox manage_clients permission

symbols.name: UserPermissionsObject
symbols.description_one_line: Typed map of per-application feature flag activation states for a user

details.what_it_does: Describes a user's permission object as optional records keyed by each application's feature enum members. The toolbox, installer, and dashboard properties are each typed as Record<`${EnumType}`, boolean>, mapping every feature flag string to a boolean activation state. A reports property is typed as Record<string, boolean> for dynamic report keys.

returns.description: An object with optional keys for each application context, each mapping feature flag strings to booleans.

minimal_correct.title: Construct a UserPermissionsObject for a dashboard user

symbols.name: userPermissionsObjectValue
symbols.description_one_line: Utility type extracting the key union for a given UserPermissionsObject application property

details.what_it_does: A generic conditional type that, given a key T of UserPermissionsObject, yields the key union of the corresponding Record value. For example, userPermissionsObjectValue<'dashboard'> resolves to keyof Record<`${FeaturesDashboard}`, boolean>, which equals the string literal union of all FeaturesDashboard members.
details.type_definition: export type userPermissionsObjectValue<T extends keyof UserPermissionsObject> = keyof UserPermissionsObject[T];

minimal_correct.title: Use the type to type-safely extract dashboard feature keys
